intro: Tracyanthus texanus, commonly known as the Texas Tracyanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States, particularly Texas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Tracyanthus texanus is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and along stream banks.
